alert.note: Alert for Dundy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Dundy County through 800 PM MDT... At 714 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles south of Champion, or 9 miles southwest of Imperial, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph, torrential rainfall, and dangerous cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Dundy County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
